Affected Products: All releases of coreutils, including 9.4-3ubuntu6.

vulnerability.raw_analysis:
CVE-2022-3219 is a vulnerability in gpgconf, a program used to control the Gnu Privacy Guard (GPG) program. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain control over a running instance of GPG, which could be used to execute arbitrary code. This vulnerability is present in the gpgconf package since version 2.4.4-2ubuntu17.3, which is available on Ubuntu 20.04 and later, but not on Ubuntu 18.04 or earlier.

Remediation: 
The vulnerability can be mitigated by using a different gpgconf package, or by disabling the GPG configuration functionality.<|endoftext|>Aim of this study is to investigate the effect of different types of poly
